info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 2 at 2:17AM CDT until May 4 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Washita River at Anadarko affecting Caddo County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Washita River at Anadarko.
* WHEN...From early this morning to Sunday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Expect near bankfull conditions along the Washita River in eastern Caddo and western Grady counties. Low-lying fields may become isolated by overflows from tributary streams.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The Washita River is expected to rise to a crest of 17.5 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO SUNDAY MORNING
